column2: New global plans unveiled to crack down on corporate tax avoidanceUPDATE 1-OECD unveils proposals to curb corporate tax avoidance * Rules aim to end "double non-taxation" - OECD   (Adds expert and NGO comment)  UPDATE 1-OECD unveils proposals to curb corporate tax avoidance * Rules aim to end "double non-taxation" - OECD   (Adds expert and NGO comment) LONDON
column3: Sept 16 Plans for a major rewriting of international tax rules unveiled on Tuesday could eliminate structures that have allowed companies like Google Inc  and Amazon.com Inc to shave billions of dollars off their tax bills.UPDATE 1-OECD unveils proposals to curb corporate tax avoidance * Rules aim to end "double non-taxation" - OECD   (Adds expert and NGO comment)

column2: American Airlines' ticket
column3: gate agents vote to unionize Sept 16 Passenger service agents at American Airlines backed union representation for the first time in their history on Tuesday
column4: with about 86 percent of members voting in favor of collective bargaining
column5: the union said.

column2: AT&T; 'intrigued' by Mexico
column3: Latin America -exec NEW YORK
column4: Sept 16 AT&T; Inc is "intrigued" by Latin America and especially Mexico and would not rule out an opportunistic deal there even as it seeks to complete its $48.5 billion planned takeover of DirecTV
column5: an AT&T; executive said at a conference on Tuesday.

column2: Bank of America forgoes $6 billion with slimmer consumer strategy NEW YORK
column3: Sept 16 Bank of America Corp  gave up about $6 billion in annual revenue by phasing out risky consumer banking products and eliminating certain fees
column4: but the long-term impact on profits should be minimal
column5: a top executive said on Tuesday.
